intro: Ageratum elachycarpum, commonly known as the common ageratum, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and the southern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters and features finely divided, gray-green foliage. Its flowers are usually blue, purple, or white, and they bloom throughout the growing season. Ageratum elachycarpum thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil.
